attributes.action: Change specialist schools starting age for disabled children.
attributes.background: last year my son was diagnosed with autism,changing our lives forever. After research and many phone calls I discovered that if a child cannot attend a mainstream school they can't attend a specialist school till reception age of 5!
attributes.additional_details: Doesn't a child with additional needs need intervention sooner rather then later? Us as parents need that help! In my son's situation starting school earlier rather then later can have a huge impact on his communication and social skills with out a shadow of a doubt..why should disabled children be left behind? Because of shortage of funding maybe? I don't know but I do know that families like mine need that stability and routine to start at age 3 not 5! Thanks for your time

attributes.action:
Give Council Tax Payers the option to OPT OUT of some service
elements
attributes.background: I believe every household or business that pays Yearly Council Taxes should have the right to OPT OUT of paying for services not required.

attributes.action: Regulate rip off student accommodation companies and their extortionate prices
attributes.background: Call on rip off student housing companies who charge extortionate rates, tie you into a contract which is too long for the academic year and who continue to rise their prices! Student loans do not get any bigger, tuition fees do not get any lower. Student housing companies need to be regulated.
attributes.additional_details: An average room in a 5 bed student house in Birmingham costs £110 a week per person per week, totalling £2200 per month. However, the same house would cost £1300 per calendar month for a professional. Students are the ones who need reasonable prices as their loans have other living costs to cover and it is impossible without help from parents. Other halls of residences charge even higher prices, with around £130 per week being the cost for a single bedroom and this is still rising!

attributes.action: Create Legislation Making Saturday & Sundays Clearing Days for Banking Purposes
attributes.background: Banks, card companies and payment processors delay consumer and customers payments using Saturday & Sundays as Non Clearing days for payments. In modern society and in the age of computers and automated systems, this is unacceptable and causes consumers and the economy delays in the money chain
attributes.additional_details: Banks state that payments can take days to register into an account excluding weekends. Credit Card Companies and Debit Card Companies advise refunds can take up to 5 days excluding weekends. Internet payment processors also exclude Saturday & Sunday from their clearing cycle, when in real terms it takes only a button to be pressed to action a payment and the computer does the rest. Most businesses operate 7 days a week and consumers live 7 days a week so why is our money regularly held by Banks

attributes.action: Introduce Road Safety Cameras that reward safe driving while discouraging unsafe
attributes.background: Problem is speeding traffic. The Road Safety Camera would do two things. It would capture speeders and issue penalties in the usual way but with an amount of the fine going into a fund pot; then if you are obeying the speed you are entered into a draw to win some of that fine money from the speeders
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thefuntheory.com/speed-camera-lottery-0
http://gamificationofwork.com/2011/10/the-speed-camera-lottery/
http://thegovlab.org/wiki/Stockholm_Speed_Camera_Lottery_(The_Fun_Theory)

attributes.action: You should be allowed to drive at the age of 14.
attributes.background: You should be allowed to drive at a younger age so that you have more freedom and this would allow youngsters to gain the skills that are needed in adulthood such as responsibility. Driving younger will take stress off parents and guardians and allow young people to gain independence and socialise.

attributes.action: Re-regulate bus services to ensure a better service and fair price for all.
attributes.background: Bus companies, nationwide are increasing prices despite poor service and lower costs to them in terms of lower price in fuel & utilities. Services often have route extensions or sometimes removed altogether which reduces overall bus numbers on the road which leads to longer waiting times.
attributes.additional_details:
De-regulation occurred in 1986 and the private companies run the services without regulation (Outside of London) which means prices can be set at any level the companies wish to set. They look to increase profits more and more each year which has a detrimental affect on the service they provide to paying customers - who rely on these services daily as a crucial transport link to get to where they need too. 
My local bus service recently raised ticket prices by up to 9.4%.

attributes.action: Require all estate agents to be licensed by an independent regulatory authority
attributes.background: There are many stories of prospective purchaser (and tenants where they are managing agents) receiving poor quality service at the hands of estate agents e.g. those who accept more than one offer on a property and effectively play one purchaser off against another for their own financial gain.
attributes.additional_details: Any one can set themselves up as an estate agent. Estate agents can sign up to voluntary regulation and many do. Those who do not often leaver those who are dissatisfied  with no legal recourse as the contractual relationship is often with another party e.g. estate agents and have no contractual relationship and arguably no duty of care to e.g. prospective purchasers. There is some limited statutory regulation for e.g. property misdescription but otherwise legal regulation is limited.

attributes.action: To oppose cuts to Further Education provision in England
attributes.background: I failed in Secondary Education but gained matriculation Qualifications at a Further Education College. FE gave me a second chance. I went on to Teacher Training College then to be a University Graduate and then Post-Graduate. I made my career as a lecturer in FE.
attributes.additional_details: For evidence I can provide a comprehensive list of students who having been given a second chance went on to be Film Makers, Film producers Radio and print journalists,actors,teachers,entrepeneurs etc

attributes.action: Review continuous lawful period ruling for ILR applicants on long secondments
attributes.background: The existing ILR ruling specifies that migrants (non-EU) must not be absent from UK for more than 180 days/year during the 5 year continuous period in order to qualify for ILR. However, this disregards absences related to long secondments outside of UK as part of employment requirements
attributes.additional_details: There have been several cases of non-EU migrants that have been deported because of this ruling (e.g. Dr Miwa Hirono). This ruling mostly affects professionals (e.g. engineers, accountants, academic professionals) working for British companies with overseas businesses as they may undertake long secondments out of UK as part of their employment. If this ruling is not revised, the UK risks losing these talented skilled professionals and the socioeconomic contributions they offer the UK.

attributes.action: Offer Government finance to first time buyers who don't qualify for a mortgage.
attributes.background:
I propose for the government to offer direct financing to first-time buyers to enable them to purchase a home.
The loan is then to be paid back to the government monthly, 
just as a mortgage would.
A deposit would still be required, so that the buyer has a vested interest in the property.
attributes.additional_details:
Banks make it incredibly difficult for first time buyers to purchase a home, even if they have a deposit.
Self-employment, minor blemishes on a credit report, or the lack of a parent to guarantee a mortgage makes things extremely difficult for first time buyers.
It would also 'Balance the books' for the government/treasury, as the property would be owned by the government until the final payment was made. Only then would ownership be transferred to the buyer.

attributes.action: Include emotional wellbeing in PSHE lessons
attributes.background: 75% of mental health problems in adult life start before the age of 18, and yet there is no requirement for schools to teach young people about mental health in PSHE lessons. In fact, PSHE is not even a statutory part of the National Curriculum. We believe this must change.
attributes.additional_details: PSHE - Personal, Social and Health and Economic Education

attributes.action: Allow all women one free trial of fertility treatment on the NHS.
attributes.background:
At the moment, women who have no children but their partner has a child from a previous relationship, are not eligible for any help with fertility on the NHS. 

Does it make a woman less worthy of a child because her partner hs one? 

All women deserve the right for help to become a mum.

attributes.action: Censor and ban IS 'recruiting' websites
attributes.background:
Young people are influenced by things they see online - the glories of joining and supporting IS. The government needs to work harder to censor this material, keeping our children safe from recruiting websites.
Terrorism isn't just actions, it's a movement - this starts with ideas put into minds.

attributes.action: Replace London with Edinburgh as UK capital
attributes.background: To foster a sense of UK-wide cohesion and inclusiveness, among Scottish people in particular. I believe that replacing London with Edinburgh as the UK's administrative capital would go some way in achieving this.
attributes.additional_details: To counter a sense of grievance, felt by many in Scotland over England’s dominance in the Union, particularly after the EU referendum. The capitals of the USA, Canada, Australia, Brazil and South Africa, are not simply their largest cities. Relocating the capital to Edinburgh will move the political centre of gravity to Northern Britain, where it is sorely needed. Anything that reduces the dominance of London over the UK without diminishing it’s global influence worldwide has to be welcomed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for neighbours to record you & your property with CCTV!
attributes.background:
Currently, there are no laws governing the use of domestic CCTV  which impacts the neighbouring resident's privacy. Neighbours are able to record you, your family & your property. LEGALLY

Your privacy can be taken away from you & placed in the hands of your neighbours! PROTECT YOUR PRIVACY!
attributes.additional_details:
My neighbour has recently installed CCTV which captures the whole of my garden. He now has 24/7 access to my whole garden and is able to sit and watch us from his smart phone whenever he wishes! 

We have asked him to move the cameras as we have children and would prefer that they are not recorded! He has refused and there is nothing we can about it but to create this petition in hopes that you will sign to help bring back our privacy. 

We need to protect ourselves and our families! PLEASE SIGN

attributes.action: Keep the same workers rights as the EU
attributes.background: Keeping the same workers rights as the EU would keep our holiday pay, sick pay, maternity leave, and follow the 48 hour working time directive.

attributes.action: Allow Norwich South to have a referendum to become independent from the UK
attributes.background: Norwich South voted to remain in the EU, the only remain constitiency in Norfolk. We shouldn't have to be taken out of the EU against our own will. If we are to remain in the UK then the Golden Triangle shall revolt!
attributes.additional_details: Norwich South was the only place in Norfolk to vote to remain in the EU, one of five in East Anglia.

attributes.action: Allow Tier 4 visa applicants use partner/spouse's bank account as proof of funds
attributes.background: Current Tier 4 (General) visa policy does not allow any flexibility regarding proof of money available to support one's studies. Applicants cannot submit their partner/spouse's personal bank statement as evidence. What if they do not have a joint account? What if their parents cannot afford it?
attributes.additional_details: The current policy states that one can ONLY use one's personal/joint/parents' account bank statements or building society statements as proof of money (aka maintenance/funds) available to support one's studies, if one did not receive any official sponsorship or apply for any loan. However, given the fact that some of the applicants are married/in a civil partnership, allowing them to present their partner/spouse's bank statement is arguably rational.

attributes.action: Ban, for at least one year, petitions on the EU referendum.
attributes.background: Rerunning debates in Parliament that have been discussed ad nauseum takes up the valuable time of MPs. The country needs to settle after a protracted build up to the recent EU referendum. Forcing further debate in Parliament is negative.

attributes.action: Give Scotland a referendum with option for independence ONLY if UK leaves EU
attributes.background: Many people in Scotland only want independence because the UK is leaving the EU and should be given this explicit option. If results of this referendum show that leaving the EU will lead to breakup of the UK, there should be another UK referendum on leaving EU as leave voters did not know this.
attributes.additional_details: Following the EU leave vote, Scottish First Minister Nicola Sturgeon is seeking an independence referendum on grounds that Scottish people do not want to leave EU. However leave voters did not know that Scottish independence was a consequence of their vote. The fairest way to address this is to urgently hold a Scottish referendum which would be binding only if UK continues to leave EU. Then UK should be given second referendum in full knowledge of the consequences of leaving EU.

attributes.action: Electoral vote of acceptance of any Prime minister not Elected
attributes.background: A lot of people vote for the public face of a political party are electing a Prime minister to lead the country, if a political party in Government has to choose a new leader whom will become Prime minister the electorate should have the right approve or reject that person.

attributes.action: EU referendum results CAN NOT be OVERTURNED or PETITIONED against within 4 years
attributes.background: If a referendum result has been won there should not be another referendum called to dispute the original within 4 years.

attributes.action: Re-establish faith in the UK by making all EU regulations UK law before leaving.
attributes.background: The UK must demonstrate to the world that it is a beacon of international collaboration, co-operation and responsibility. We should start by enshrining into UK law all the regulations and agreements that would expire when we leave the EU, so that it takes a change of law to break an agreement.
attributes.additional_details: We need to show that we don't discard our international agreements and responsibilities lightly, while also boosting confidence that things remain as they are now unless Parliament decides otherwise. We should adopt into law a presumption that each of our international commitments will remain in effect unless a new law is passed to revoke it. We don't want to throw out the good rules with the bad, and we should properly debate each rule we want to get rid of, and know which rules will go, when.

attributes.action: Calculate results based on number of registered voters even those who abstain.
attributes.background: The official result of the EU referendum was that 52% voted leave, whereas when the total number of registered voters was taken into account the result was only 37%. Likewise, in the last General Election in at least one area the number of abstainers was greater than the winning candidate's margin.
attributes.additional_details: There is a large portion of the country who choose not to vote as they believe it will make no difference. We the undersigned believe it's time to change the system so that result percentages are calculated using the number of registered voters and not only those who voted. We believe that this will give a more accurate picture of what the citizens of this country want.

attributes.action: Continue a pro immigration policy and recognise the value migrants bring the UK
attributes.background: As part of the EU exit negotiations the UK government should seek a deal that will maintain the current rights of all EU citizens in the UK and that will keep the UK border open to economic migrants and refugees alike.
attributes.additional_details:
In addition the UK government should take steps to fully explain to the public the great benefits that migration brings to the UK.

A large number of people who voted to leave in the recent referendum will have done so as a rejection of the federalist agenda of the EU and in favour of national sovereignty and democracy. They did not vote for a rejection of migrants or as a vote to close our borders. As such there is no mandate for a anti immigration policy

attributes.action: Hold a second Brexit referendum in 2 years so that more young voters have a say.
attributes.background: Article 50 means that we do not formally leave the EU for at least two years. During this time a large number of 16-17 year olds will become eligible to vote. The government will not lower the voting age, but we should allow eligible youngsters to decide either way on their future.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should also consider working with the youth parliament and implementing a way of allowing them to have a say on their future.

attributes.action: Form an Interim Brexit Government to negotiate the UK's extraction from the EU.
attributes.background:
Dissolve the current Government.
Form an Interim Brexit Government (IBG) with no Remain members in it.
No General Election will be held until the final withdrawal from the EU. 
This is to provide stability until extraction from the EU.
IBG must be made up of members of all parties.
attributes.additional_details:
The PM of the IBG must be chosen by the MP's of Westminster only to prevent factionalism from devolved Governments.
Oversight committees to consist equally of Remain and Brexit members and an independent chairman, to provide the checks and balances required in the EU extraction talks.
Inform Scottish and Northern Irish that if, after the final EU extraction process is complete and they still want to hold a referendum then they can hold them then.

attributes.action: Allow the youth (14-17) to vote in larger elections/referendums
attributes.background:
Big decisions affects them as well, and their future should be the prime concern at the heart of future referendums. 
At the end of the day it is there futures on the line and it would be selfish to deny them a vote.
not letting them vote would be scandalous and would cause outrage among them.
attributes.additional_details:
This is backed up by the fact that YouGov's statistics said 18-24 year olds mostly voted to remain. 
Young people are also told to voice their opinion and this would help them alot, whilst also introducing them to politics and wanting to contribute to society.

attributes.action: No more cuts for working age people. Remove ringfencing of pensioner benefits
attributes.background: Since the financial crisis and recession it's young and working age people who have born the brunt of budget cutbacks. Real wages have fallen 7% for working families and 16% for 18-24 year olds. Pensioners have seen a 4% increase in the incomes which is neither fair or sustainable going forward.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst efforts to raise living standards in the elderly population is commendable, the disparity is now too great and ringfencing of pensioner benefits should be removed. This has become even more pressing in light out the EU referendum where the over 65 group voted strongly in favour of leaving the EU. Any negative economic effects of this decision should be shared across all who voted for it.

Figures quoted from Machin 2015

attributes.action: Call another EU referendum for those aged 16-30
attributes.background: What should have been done previously and what should be addressed now, is the importance of the generation whom the EU referendum would effect. Therefore it is my request that as a generation, we should be given the choice, rather than our elders making that choice for us.

attributes.action: Count non-voters as a vote for the status quo in referendums.
attributes.background: People who vote do so to express their choice.  By not voting, people are saying they are not really concerned either way.  If they held a strong conviction they would have voted.  Change should not be imposed without taking these non-voters into account.
attributes.additional_details:
The in-out EU referendum is a case in point. Fewer than half the voting public voted for change but change will happen because insufficient people voted for the status quo.

Non-voters who weren't really concerned, or who didn't vote because they thought the status quo would win, should have their 'vote' counted.

To make a significant change (eg leaving the EU) more than half of the voting public should vote for it, ie not half of the voters.

attributes.action: Ensure the Brexit negotiating team is politically representative
attributes.background: The UK has just voted to leave the EU and after Article 50 is triggered we will have to negotiate the terms of our disengagement within two years. Our current government gained a parliamentary majority with just 37% of the vote. It does not have a mandate to carry out these negotiations on its own.
attributes.additional_details: Requirements of negotiation: The team negotiating our terms of our disengagement from the EU should consist of MPs from all parties. The final terms should only be considered passed if voted for by a super-majority (66%) in parliament. Each constituent nation's administration shall have a veto over the terms.

attributes.action: Allow just THE CAR to be insured, not each individual driver of a car.
attributes.background: Sign the petition to allow just a car to be insured by a person and not have to insure every specific person for a specific car.

attributes.action: Give greater autonomy to Northern England and create a Northern Assembly
attributes.background: The North of England is a diverse and great place and deserves to have the same say about its own laws and futures as places such as Wales and Scotland.

attributes.action: A referendum on whether or not parliament should endorse the Brexit vote
attributes.background: Only 51.9% of the 72% who voted supported the Brexit. The impact of Brexit will be such that the decision should not be left to this 37.368% of the electorate. This is not enough to endorse Brexit alone. An effort has to be made to ensure that a practical plan is made that the public can review.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not calling for another EU referendum. This is calling for a referendum on the consequence of the EU referendum. 

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

attributes.action: Hold a second, and if necessary, third EU Referendum for a best-of-three vote.
attributes.background:
With the EU Referendum results having been announced, there is a clear divide between the country, a result bordering a tie with less than a two-percent margin. 
Those undersigned believe that a second vote should be held, to confirm the wishes of the British people, with a third vote if necessary.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a big decision for our country. The results of the first EU referendum to decide whether or not we should remain within the European Union have already affected our nation in significant ways, most notable of which being the value of the pound, and that decision should not be left for a singular vote.

If a second vote were to happen, and the results declared the same, then no more referendums would be necessary and such a decision taken forward.

attributes.action: London should be re-classified as part of Scotland in light of the EU vote.
attributes.background: In light of how the various regions voted in the EU referendum, I propose that London should be re-classified as part of Scotland. Thus enabling us to remain part of the EU if, as is likely, Scotland votes for independence from the UK.
attributes.additional_details: This would enable London's financial markets to still have the benefits of EU membership and would also strengthen the Scottish economy.

attributes.action: London to receive the same treatment as Scotland in a Vote to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
London Voted democratically to stay in with EU. Our businesses, lives and culture thrive on being a world city tolerant and thriving thanks to migration.

We voted IN! But they want to take us OUT. 

Sign this if you believe London deserves the same treatment as Scotland in its future.
attributes.additional_details: It's perfectly reasonable to propose a one country two systems format, that runs successfully in other countries, and allow London its democratic decision.

attributes.action: Overhaul The New GCSE's Making Them Easier For Students Sitting Them In 2017
attributes.background: The New GCSE's Have been declared 'too hard' by the exams regulator. Students will be sitting them around June 2017 and so far Mocks and Practice papers have shown the pass rate to be low! Others have quoted that a mark lower than 50% would be required to achieve an A Grade! They are just too hard.
attributes.additional_details:
We Want The Goverment To Consider changing the Maths exams for 2017 making them less challenging for students, many experts have agreed they are simply to hard! 
Please read  the following BBC Article http://goo.gl/FCxYI7 The changes brought in my Michael Gove were exceptionally radical and don't allow children to achieve their fullest potential, Sign the petition to make the new GCSEs fairer for our kids and the leaders of the future.

attributes.action: Make all Diesel power plant applications require Environmental Impact Assessment
attributes.background: There are £175m in subsidies to build heavily polluting diesel power plants to provide the UK with backup energy generating capacity. Bizarrely these require less Environmental impact assessment than a single wind turbine.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour
attributes.background: Make it illegal for all shops and companies using job applicants as free labour disguising it as a trial. This is wrong it gives applicants the impression that they have a job when in fact they don't. Anyone who carries out work should be paid

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for disabled toilets/nappy change areas to have a wall hook.
attributes.background: Disabled people and parents of children using nappy change areas carry bags too. Yet hardly any disabled toilets have pegs or hooks on the walls or doors. Why should the user have to put their belongings on a dirty toilet floor? A peg or hook on the wall or back of the door is a simple solution.
attributes.additional_details: I am the parent of an autistic child still in nappies at age 5. I have become increasingly frustrated at having to put my change bag on dirty toilet floors when a peg or hook would be so cheap to supply and install.

attributes.action: Decrease length of employment time needed to qualify for paternity leave.
attributes.background: I hadn't realised until recently how poor paternity rights in this country are. It is unfair and ridiculous that a man needs to have worked 26 weeks, 15 weeks before the due date, at a company in order to simply qualify for 1 week off work to spend time with his child and the mother.
attributes.additional_details: This is completely disproportionate to the amount of time the father gets off work. It is an important time for both parents as they bond with their child, and indeed a difficult time as they both learn to be parents. It is against every idea of fairness and equality, British values, that fathers do not automatically qualify for at least 1 week for paternity. The length of time they have to have worked there simply must be reduced, and for that matter they should be able to apply for more.

attributes.action: Means test Maternity Pay reflecting women on leave who are 'the breadwinner'
attributes.background:
The current basic ruling on maternity pay is as follows :

Statutory Maternity Pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get:
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks
- £139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks
attributes.additional_details:
Information from:
https://www.gov.uk/maternity-pay-leave/pay

attributes.action: Free swimming concessions for elderly on a national basis.
attributes.background: To increase health and activity of older population at all public pools . Older people have limited income so free swimming would encourage healthier lifestyle.  Pools are paid out of council tax so should benifit local elderly .

attributes.action: Force credit/debit card providers allow a customer block on contactless payments
attributes.background: Contactless payments are a security risk. They permit criminals to collect users data using unauthorised scanners, the "Contactless Infusion X5" being sold by "CC Buddies" for £500, is just one of them.
attributes.additional_details:
Please see the following recent Daily Star article:-

http://www.dailystar.co.uk/news/latest-news/522417/Fraud-clone-bank-cards-contactless-device

attributes.action: Make schools have Meatless Mondays in order to reduce pollution.
attributes.background: I believe all UK schools should introduce Meatless Mondays in order to reduce the pollution caused by the meat trade and for students to help reduce pollution in a way that also promotes kindness, compassion and respect for other life.

attributes.action: Support Hindu Community Temple of Threat of Closure Retaining Spiritual Heritage
attributes.background:
We the undersigned object to the closure of the VRAJDHAM  HAVELI (TEMPLE) Leicester, as a consequence of the Priest not being able to perform religious duties.

We call upon the Home Office to reinstate VSUK's sponsorship license immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a heartfelt appeal to stop violation of our Hindu religious freedom and abuse of racial tolerance.

Without this reinstatement the significance would be:
 
A) The Vrajdham Haveli (Temple) will be forced to close down
B) The deity (Lord Krishna) will have to return back to India
C) An irrecoverable loss to the Hindu community, culture, sentiment and beliefs
D) A destruction of a thriving national community centre

attributes.action: More Gender Identity Clinics. Train up doctors and use local practices.
attributes.background: We need more Gender Identity Clinics and more trained doctors so that all Trans patients get quicker service. The longer the waiting time, the more suicides we'll see...
